newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Weak Australian bonds still outclass Canada.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Weak Australian bonds still outclass Canada.

text.p: Australian bonds finished weaker, but still managed to outpace the Canadian market which dropped heavily on Wednesday.
A combination of a weaker Canadian dollar, new supply and an unwinding of recent spread tightening plays to the U.S. all contributed to the slide.
Against the U.S., local bonds slightly underperformed against a growing feeling that the dramatic narrowing seen since April may have found a base around the 100 basis points level.
New Zealand bonds, meanwhile, reversed an initial tightening trend to Australia after comments by RBNZ governor Don Brash saying the N.Z. dollar was near the top of its cycle.
